body_html: @keveman: Could this be related to the build configuration or the dlopen() flags that we're using to support tf.load_op_library() and friends? Perhaps there's some way we could structure the libraries so that import cv2 doesn't link against TensorFlow's internal libjpeg or libpng?
body_text: @keveman: Could this be related to the build configuration or the dlopen() flags that we're using to support tf.load_op_library() and friends? Perhaps there's some way we could structure the libraries so that import cv2 doesn't link against TensorFlow's internal libjpeg or libpng?
body: @keveman: Could this be related to the build configuration or the `dlopen()` flags that we're using to support `tf.load_op_library()` and friends? Perhaps there's some way we could structure the libraries so that `import cv2` doesn't link against TensorFlow's internal `libjpeg` or `libpng`?
